results.name: Smallest even k such that lpf(k-1) = prime(n), while lpf(k-3) > prime(n), where lpf=least prime factor (A020639).
comment: This sequence is connected with a sufficient condition for the infinitude of twin primes.
Almost all numbers of the form a(n)-3 are primes. For composite numbers of such a form, see A242716.
Primes p for which a(p) = p^2+1 form sequence A062326 for p >= 3. - _Vladimir Shevelev_, May 21 2014
link: Peter J. C. Moses, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..2501
example: Let n=2, prime(2)=3. Then lpf(10-1)=3, but lpf(10-3)=7>3.
Since k=10 is the smallest such k, then a(2)=10.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {k = 6; p = prime(n); while ((factor(k-1)[1, 1] != p) || (factor(k-3)[1, 1] <= p), k+= 2); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 16 2014
